verses.kjv: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
verses.ct: We sat beside the rivers of Babylon and cried as we thought about Zion.

verses.kjv: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
verses.ct: We hung our harps on the willow trees along the banks.

verses.kjv: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.
verses.ct: Our captors demanded that we sing for them. Our tormentors wanted entertainment, saying, 'Sing us one of those songs from Zion.'

verses.kjv: How shall we sing the LORD’s song in a strange land?
verses.ct: How could we possibly sing the LORD's song in a foreign land?

verses.kjv: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.
verses.ct: If I ever forget you, Jerusalem, let my right hand lose its skill.

verses.kjv: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.
verses.ct: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I fail to remember you — if I don't place Jerusalem above my greatest joy.

verses.kjv: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.
verses.ct: LORD, remember what the people of Edom did on the day Jerusalem fell. They shouted, 'Tear it down! Tear it down to its foundations!'

verses.kjv: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.
verses.ct: Babylon, you are destined for destruction. Blessed is the one who repays you for what you did to us.

verses.kjv: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.
verses.ct: Blessed is the one who seizes your infants and smashes them against the rocks.
